text: Damar Core, better known by his stage name Hona Costello or Hona, is an American, rapper, producer, and singer from Chicago, Illinois. Following the success of his debut mixtape "Follow me", he was featured on Music Connection top prospects of 2012. In October 2014, he produced Dej Loaf single On My Own on her debut mixtape Sell Sole. ==Early life and career== Hona Costello was born in Blue Island, IL. Costello dropped his first CD "Paradise" at a young age, but what gained him fame was his 2011 mixtape entitled "Follow Me." The mixtape was downloaded more than 20,000 times and made "The Journey Through Law School's" Top 50 Albums of 2011 list. From Sauk Village, IL he moved to Los Angeles, California in 2011 to pursue his dreams. In 2012 Hona Costello released the critically acclaimed single, High labeled "the best damn smoking song I’ve heard in a minute". In 2015, Costello help launch music festival No Major, No Problem for independent artists. He also signed a deal with The Administration MP. In 2019 Hona Costello started his own music group called Blk Fox Gng. ===Mixtape=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text- align:center;" border="1" |+ List of mixtapes, with selected details ! scope="col" style="width:8em;"| Title ! scope="col" style="width:18em;"| Album details ! scope="col" style="width:18em;"| Streams |- ! scope="row"| Paradise | * Released: 2006 * Formats: CD, digital download | 250,000 |- ! scope="row"| Follow Me | * Released: 2011 * Formats: digital download | 400,000 |- ! scope="row"| Penelope Prelude | * Released: 2012 * Formats: digital download | 2,068,000 |- ! scope="row"| Vol. 1: the Fox [incomplete] | * Released: 2017 * Formats: digital download | 450,000 |- |} ===Singles=== * "High" (2012) ===Production Discography=== * Dej Loaf – On My Own * Ramaj Eroc – I, Pray * Dej Loaf – Birdcall 1.5 == References == Category:1989 births Category:Living people Category:African-American male rappers Category:Musicians from Chicago Category:People from Blue Island, Illinois Category:People from Sauk Village, Illinois Category:American cannabis activists Category:21st-century American rappers Category:21st-century American male musicians
